meanings.definition: The quality of being clever and humorous in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her wittinesses always make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's wittinesses were appreciated by the audience.
meanings.sent3: His wittinesses brightened up the dull meeting.
meanings.sent4: The wittinesses in her stories sparkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's wittinesses made learning fun and engaging.

meanings.definition: Instances of clever and humorous remarks or behavior.
meanings.sent1: We all enjoyed the wittinesses shared during the party.
meanings.sent2: His wittinesses always lighten the mood in the office.
meanings.sent3: The wittinesses at the family dinner kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her wittinesses were like fireworks in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The wittinesses of the children brought smiles to everyone's faces.
